questions.text: A 35-year-old male complained of fatigue and passing dark-colored urine this morning. His blood reports showed an Hb of 10g/dL, and a peripheral smear showed normocytic normochromic anemia. His flow cytometry for RBCs is shown below. Which of the following is a likely finding when his blood smear is stained using crystal violet?

options.label: C
options.text: Tendon of the long head of the biceps

questions.explanation: Correct Option D - Acromioclavicular lig

A female patient presented with complaints of foul-smelling frothy vaginal discharge and intense itching. On examination, the cervix appears strawberry-like. Cyst is an infective stage.
questions.explanation: Correct Option B - 2 and 3

questions.text: A patient is suspected of meningitis. On gram staining of his CSF, the following finding is made (shown in the image below). Antimicrobial Therapy of central nervous system Bacterial Infections Based on pathogena

Organism

Antibiotic

Neisseria meningitides

  • Penicillin-resistant

  • Penicillin-sensitive
  • Penicillin-intermediate
  • Penicillin resistant

 

  • Penicillin G

  • Ceftriaxone (or cefotaxime or cefepime) + vancomycin

Gram-negative bacilli (except Pseudomonas spp.)

Ceftriaxone or cefotaxime

Pseudomonas aeruginosa

Ceftazidime or cefepime or meropenem

Staphylococci spp.

  • Methicillin-sensitive
  • Methicillin-resistant

 

  • Nafcillin
  • Vancomycin

Listeria monocytogenes

Ampicillin + gentamicin

Haemophilus influenzae

Ceftriaxone or cefotaxime if beta-lactamase positive; ampicillin if beta-lactamase negative

Penicillin G or ampicillin

Bacteroides fragilis

Metronidazole

Fusobacterium spp.

Metronidazole

questions.explanation: Correct Option D - 1, 2, and 3

options.text: Reassure the patient to follow diet and exercise diligently

Management

questions.text: Which of the following is matched incorrectly?

options.label: A

options.label: D
options.text: Excessive suspiciousness and distrust of others, interpreting their actions as deliberately harmful or deceitful - Paranoid Personality Disorder

questions.correct_answer: A. Individuals consider themselves special and expect special treatment - Histrionic Personality Disorder

questions.text: Match the following: JVP Waveform Component Corresponding Event A wave Y descent V wave C wave a. Atrial contraction b. Passive atrial relaxation c. Tricuspid valve bulging into the right atrium during isovolumetric ventricular contraction. d. Atrial filling against closed tricuspid valve e. Passive emptying of the right atrium into the ventricle due to opening of the tricuspid valve.
questions.explanation:
Correct Option A - 1-a, 2-e, 3-d, 4

JVP Wave Component

Corresponding Event

A wave

Atrial contraction

X & X' descent

Passive atrial relaxation

V wave

Atrial filling against closed tricuspid valve

Y descent

Passive emptying of the atrium into the ventricle due to opening of tricuspid valve

C wave

Tricuspid valve bulging into right atrium during isovolumetric ventricular contraction

options.text: Both the positive predictive value (PPV) and NPV of the test have increased.

options.text: The PPV of the test is decreased.

A graph is provided showing an exponential decrease in the plasma concentration of a drug over time. What type of kinetics does this graph represent, and which property is characteristic of this type of elimination?

options.label: A
options.text: Zero-order kinetics; elimination is constant and independent of plasma concentration.

options.label: B
options.text: First-order kinetics; elimination is constant and independent of plasma concentration.

options.label: C
options.text: Zero-order kinetics; elimination is directly proportional to plasma concentration.

options.label: D
options.text: First-order kinetics; elimination is directly proportional to plasma concentration.

questions.correct_answer: D. First-order kinetics; elimination is directly proportional to plasma concentration.
questions.explanation: Correct Option D – First-order kinetics; elimination is directly proportional to plasma

questions.text: Which one of the below-mentioned structures does not pierce the marked structure?

options.label: A
options.text: Coccygeal branch of the inferior gluteal artery

questions.explanation:
Correct Option C - Posterior femoral cutaneous nerv

1.

Coccygeal branch of the inferior gluteal artery

Arises from the inferior gluteal artery pierce the sacrotuberous ligament and supply blood to the adjacent tissues.

2.

Perforating cutaneous nerve

Pierces the sacrotuberous ligament and extends to supply the area of the skin over the gluteus maximus.

3.

Anococcygeal nerve

Arises from the coccygeal plexus and pierces the sacrotuberous ligament to innervate the anal region.

questions.text: A 5-year-old child, vaccinated to date, presents to the emergency department with a high fever, severe sore throat, difficulty swallowing, and drooling of saliva. Upon examination, an inspiratory stridor is observed. A lateral view X-ray of the neck reveals the following finding. The causative organism of the condition is___________.
questions.explanation:
Correct Option D - Streptococcus pneu

Acute Epiglottitis

Acute Laryngo–Tracheo-Bronchitis/Croup

  • Inflammation of Epiglottitis.

  • Only supraglottic structures, i.e., epiglottis, aryepiglottic folds, and arytenoids.

Inflammation of the larynx, trachea, and bronchus.

 

Cause: Bacterial infection – Streptococcus pneumonia (M/C) > H influenzae

Cause: viral infection - para influenza 1 & 2 (M/C)

Age group: 3-6 years.

Age group: 3 months to 3 years.

Symptoms:

  • Malaise and fever: High, and the child looks toxic

  • Respiratory: Inspiratory stridor

  • Digestive: Dysphagia, Odynophagia, and drooling of saliva.

  • Phonatory/ voice: No change in voice and no cough.

Symptoms:

  • Malaise and fever: Low grade or no fever, and the child is not toxic

  • Respiratory: Biphasic stridor.

  • Digestive: Not present or mild.

  • Phonatory/ voice: Change in voice and cough barking seal-like cough.

Diagnosis: Lateral view X-ray of the neck: thumb sign due to swollen epiglottis.

Diagnosis: Anteroposterior view of the neck: steeple sign due to subglottic stenosis.

questions.text: An image of the shoulder joint region is given in the figure. Identify the type of epiphyses A, B, and C respectively:

options.label: A
options.text: A. Atavistic, B. traction and C. pressure

options.label: B
options.text: A. Traction, B. atavistic and C. pressure

options.label: C
options.text: A. Atavistic, B. aberrant and C. traction

options.label: D
options.text: A. Atavistic, B. pressure and C. traction

questions.correct_answer: D. A. Atavistic, B. pressure and C. traction
questions.explanation:
Correct Option D - A. Atavistic, B. pressure and C.

Epiphysis

Definition

Example

Pressure epiphysis

Takes part in the joint and is intracapsular. They transmit weight

Head of humerus and femur and condyles of humerus, femur, tibia etc

Traction epiphysis

Non-articular and does not take part in weight transmission. Appear later than pressure epiphysis

Mastoid process, Greater and lesser tubercle of the humerus, Greater and lesser trochanter of femur

Atavistic epiphysis

Phylogenetically independent but fused to the nearest bone for nutrition

Coracoid process of scapula, Os trigonum

Aberrant Ephiphysis

Not always present

Head of 1st metacarpal bone, The base of the other metacarpal bones

questions.text: In a patient with nontoxic multinodular goiter, which of the following increases the risk of a thyroid storm?

options.label: A
options.text: Administration of saturated solution of potassium iodide for 10 days

questions.correct_answer: B. Administration of iodine-containing contrast media
questions.explanation:
Wolf-Chaikoff effect

Jod-Basedow effect
  • A large dose of iodine (saturated solution of potassium iodide) for 10 days is given.
  • Results in the downgrading of iodine trapping, which decreases T4 & T3 production.
  • Prevents thyroid storm
  • This is seen with excess iodine and absent autoregulation.
  • Results in an increase in iodine trapping, which increases T4 &T3 production.
  • Preciptates thyroid storm.
